snippet: Bruce Springsteen and Paul McCartney had to take an early bow during a concert in London on Saturday after organizers turned off their microphones for exceeding the park’s sound curfew, The Associated Press reported.
abstract: Organizers cut the power off during a concert at Hyde Park in London featuring Bruce Springsteen and Paul McCartney, after the performance exceeded the park's sound curfew.
lead_paragraph: Bruce Springsteen and Paul McCartney had to take an early bow during a concert in London on Saturday after organizers turned off their microphones for exceeding the park’s sound curfew, The Associated Press reported.

headline.main: A Plug Is Pulled on Stars Rocking Into the Night
headline.print_headline: A Plug Is Pulled on Stars Rocking Into the Night
